Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic epistolary text on recto only (11 ll., palimpsest). Thompson' MS Catalogue: "Letter written by Necht-Mout son of Pary (? Paret) to his brother Teteese relating to a burial".
Curator's comments: Published in translation by Revillout as 'Papyrus Dogdson No 2, une denonciation contre un voleur de la necropole'. RE 6 (1892), 101-2. To be re-published by Maria Cannata. See also PSBA 31 (1909), 101, 289.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (51887) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/51887)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss Black ink Supported locally: glassine paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
